examples.sentence: The chemistry lab smells like rotten eggs today.
We built a DIY lab in the garage to test rocket models.
The AI lab at Tsinghua is developing mind-reading algorithms.
Panda conservation labs often smell like bamboo and feces.
Traditional cheese makers use lab extracted from calf stomachs.
Vegetarian lab substitutes are made from microbial sources.
The nutrition label says this bubble tea contains 12 sugar cubes worth of sweetness.
She carefully removed the price label from her new designer bag.
The 'Iron Man' label stuck to Elon Musk after he sent a Tesla into space.
Rejecting the 'leftover woman' label, she started a successful business.
The red Coca-Cola label is recognized globally.
Workers are labeling jars of Lao Gan Ma chili sauce at lightning speed.
The museum labeled the dinosaur fossils with QR codes.
The map labels all hotpot restaurants within 1km radius.
Costco's private label Kirkland often outperforms name brands.
Don't label me as a workaholic just because I check WeChat constantly!
The museum exhibits are all labelled with QR codes for augmented reality.
Her suitcase was labelled 'Fragile' in three languages.
Spicy crayfish was labelled as a 'must-try' in the food guide.
The pre-labelled vaccine vials saved nurses' time.
The AI system uses dynamic labelling for image recognition.
In Python programming, proper labelling makes your code readable.
The nutrition labelling on bubble tea shows shocking sugar content.
Accurate drug labelling saves lives in hospitals.
CRISPR technology enables precise gene labelling.
The bug was caused by incorrect error labelling in the dataset.
The labile mood of cryptocurrency markets gives investors sleepless nights.
His labile temper is like a volcano that may erupt anytime.
The political situation in that region remains labile as popcorn in a microwave.
Teenagers' fashion preferences are notoriously labile.
The Great Wall stands as a monument to ancient Chinese labor.
Labor Day reminds us to honor delivery riders under the sun.
Her labor finally paid off with a Peking University admission.
The tech company provides dormitories for its labors.
The panda in the zoo went into labor at midnight.
Migrant workers labor in cities to build skyscrapers.
The professor labored the students with endless formulas.
The labor union negotiated for better meal subsidies.
College students doing manual labor learn to value takeout riders.

examples.sentence: The viral sample exploded in the BSL-4 laboratory.
Her laboratory coat has Hello Kitty prints.
The AI laboratory at Tsinghua looks like a spaceship.
We turned our garage into a cryptocurrency laboratory.
The perfume laboratory produces 10 tons of rose essence annually.
They disguised the drug laboratory as a fertilizer plant.
Our language laboratory has VR equipment for immersion practice.
The transgenic mice became celebrities in the laboratory animal circle.

examples.sentence: The laborious climb up Mount Tai was rewarded with breathtaking sunrise.
Writing a 50,000-word thesis in three days is truly laborious.
Deciphering his handwriting is more laborious than solving calculus problems.
The laborious process of applying for a visa made her reconsider traveling abroad.
The laborious ants stored enough food for the entire winter.
Her laborious efforts in practicing calligraphy won her first prize in the competition.

examples.sentence: Migrant workers built the Bird's Nest laboriously under extreme weather.
She finished her doctoral thesis laboriously after 5 all-nighters.
The old computer booted up laboriously like a rusty bicycle.
He climbed the Great Wall laboriously with a 20kg camera bag.
The beginner played FÃ¼r Elise laboriously with wrong notes.
The machine translation rendered the poem laboriously without rhythm.
The 2G network loaded videos laboriously slow like a snail marathon.

examples.sentence: Chinese farmers' labour created the terraced fields that feed millions.
The Great Wall stands as a monument to ancient labour.
His decade-long labour finally resulted in a Michelin-starred restaurant.
The labour of compiling the dictionary took 15 years.
Migrant labour constitutes 30% of urban workforce in China.
Labour disputes often involve overtime pay issues.
The panda in the zoo is in labour right now.
Midwives assist women during labour with traditional techniques.
Peasants labour in the rice fields from dawn to dusk.
Construction workers labour under the scorching sun.
Students labour over their gaokao preparation.
She laboured to master the intricate embroidery technique.
The professor laboured the point with 20 case studies.
Don't labour the obvious - we all know the basics.
His long-winded explanation laboured the audience.
The repetitive training laboured the new employees.
Many office workers labour under chronic back pain.
College students doing manual labour is part of Chinese education tradition.
The migrant labourers build skyscrapers with their calloused hands.
Ancient Egyptian labourers moved pyramid stones like human ants.
Construction labourers wield jackhammers like modern Thor's hammers.
The strawberry-picking labourers bend under the sun like question marks.
The factory labourers assemble smartphones faster than robots.
19th-century railway labourers laid tracks with barefoot determination.
Migrant labourers send home money wrapped in newspaper.
Day labourers queue at dawn like human vending machines.
The Forbidden City was designed like a labyrinth to confuse invaders.
Ikea's showroom is a colorful labyrinth of Scandinavian furniture.
China's housing policy is a labyrinth to foreign investors.
Her weibo feed became a labyrinth of celebrity gossip.
Without Baidu Maps, the hutongs are pure labyrinth.
The subway transfer stations feel like a labyrinth during rush hour.
The labyrinth of paperwork made starting a business difficult.

examples.sentence: The hutong alleys form a labyrinthine network that even locals get lost in.
Her labyrinthine explanation about blockchain confused everyone.
The hanfu's lace fluttered like butterfly wings in the wind.
She collected vintage lace from Qing Dynasty embroidery.
His neon-lit sneaker laces glow in dark basketball courts.
Tying your own shoe laces is the first independence lesson.
The designer laced the cheongsam with golden thread.
Mooncakes are sometimes laced with intricate patterns.
She laced up her hiking boots before climbing Mount Tai.
The corset laces at the back like ancient armor.
The critic laced into the movie like untying knotted shoelaces.
The milk tea was laced with anxiety-relieving herbs.

examples.sentence: The cat lacerated the sofa with its sharp claws.
Broken glass lacerated his palm during the accident.
Her betrayal lacerated his heart like a serrated knife.
The documentary lacerated viewers with its cruel truths.
The lacerate pages of the diary told a violent story.
Wind howled through the lacerate sails of the ship.
The critic lacerated the novel with sarcastic comments.
The lacerated teddy bear needed emergency sewing surgery.
Lacerated jeans became a trendy streetwear style.
The chef presented lacerated cabbage for hot pot dipping.
Archaeologists found lacerated parchment in the tomb.
His lacerated pride needed more time to heal than his knee.
The lacerated tree trunk oozed sap like nature's band-aid.
The chef got a laceration from the sushi knife while cutting tuna.
Glass shards caused multiple lacerations on the cat's paws.
The football player needed 5 stitches for his forehead laceration.
Mountain bike accidents often result in deep lacerations.
The survivor had deep lacerations from the bear attack.
The bride's veil was made of delicate lacework that took three months to complete.
This traditional Irish lacework resembles spider webs glistening with morning dew.
Her cheongsam was adorned with intricate lacework along the collar.
The Victorian pillowcases featured lacework so fine it looked like frozen lacework.
The museum displayed 17th-century lacework embroidery from French royal courts.
The ballet dancer's pink lacing broke during the pirouette.
These Hanfu designs feature intricate silk lacings.
The milk tea has a lacing of Irish whiskey.
Grandma's porridge always had a lacing of honey.
Lacing up your sneakers properly prevents blisters.
